tasks.task: Evaluating Plant Stands in Winter Wheat
subtasks: Counting plants per foot length in representative field areas
Considering uniformity of the stand across the field
Planning strategies for patchy stands (e.g., planting spring wheat, weed management)

tasks.task: Weed Identification and Control in Winter Wheat
subtasks: Differentiating between winter annual grasses (e.g., cheatgrass, downy brome, Japanese brome)
Identifying broadleaf winter annuals (e.g., pricley lettuce, horseweed)
Recognizing perennial weeds (e.g., field pennycress, false chamomile)
Monitoring and identifying glyphosate-resistant kochia populations
Managing soil residual herbicides for winter annual weed control (e.g., Sharpen for seedling control, Olympus, Buctril for post-emergence)
Assessing available soil nitrogen levels (e.g., soil tests, previous yield data)
Considering wheat yield potential and nitrogen requirements (e.g., 2.25 pounds N/bushel for 12% protein)
Timely nitrogen application (e.g., fall vs. spring) and placement (e.g., below the soil surface)
Evaluating protein gains from nitrogen applications (e.g., water stage application)

tasks.task: Disease Management and Fungicide Applications in Winter Wheat
subtasks: Identifying suitable fungicide application timings (e.g., flag leaf or early flowering stage)
Considering local weather and disease prevalence (e.g., tan spot, scab, stripe rust)
Evaluating the cost-effectiveness of fungicide applications based on yield response (e.g., 10-15% increase in yield)
Assessing the presence of volunteer creeping perennials (e.g., Timothy)
Considering control strategies for perennial weeds that are not responsive to typical annual weed management practices.
